items.title: Django 3.0 Compatibility
items.body:
Hello,

The support for the context argument of Field.from_db_value() and Expression.convert_value() is removed in Django 3.0 (https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.0/releases/3.0/)

The context argument is used in

https://github.com/divio/djangocms-text-ckeditor/blob/bce4f2e5ef00b17d370605425abbb74bd4b878e3/djangocms_text_ckeditor/fields.py#L46

Kr,
Patrick

items.title: Deprecation warning due to invalid escape sequences
items.body:
Deprecation warnings are raised due to invalid escape sequences. This can be fixed by using raw strings or escaping the literals. pyupgrade also helps in automatic conversion : https://github.com/asottile/pyupgrade/ . With noqa I guess this is intentionally ignored but given that it's raising deprecation warning it will be good to fix it.

```
find . -iname '*.py' | grep -Ev 'test.py' | xargs -P4 -I{} python3.8 -Wall -m py_compile {}
./tests/test_plugin.py:118: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \d
  return re.findall('\d+', url)[0]  # noqa
```

Changing the from_db_value method to the below definition fixes the issue.

    def from_db_value(self, value, expression, connection, context=None):

items.title: WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You Get) editor doesn't show how the real result is going to look
items.body:
Probably on all of my projects I can observe the issue from the screenshot below - WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You Get) editor actually doesn't who what the editor is going to get:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36416236/79671644-b0f33480-81d4-11ea-9156-ce3a012bf153.png)

![Screenshot 2020-04-19 at 00 40 18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36416236/79671884-5b1f8c00-81d6-11ea-827a-c14a2cc61f73.png)

In the scenario above TextPlugin is rendered within a custom ArticleCardPlugin, hence the text is styled differently in the end.

Today I implemented a simple solution:

```
class SectionPlugin(CMSPluginBase):
    # ...
    allow_children = True
    ckeditor_body_css_class = 'section-plugin'

class ArticleCardPlugin(CMSPluginBase):
    # ...
    allow_children = True
    ckeditor_body_css_class = 'article-card'
```

With it when I add a `TextPlugin` into an `ArticleCard`, which is placed within a `SectionPlugin` CKEditor will add `article-card section-plugin` css classes to the `<body>` of its WYSIWYG iframe. After that we can do anything we want with the editor body using the project scss styles - make body background blue, customize bootstrap button styles in there, etc.

Here's how the end result can look like:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36416236/79672380-0251f280-81da-11ea-82ac-6c5ed85eaa78.png)

Initial state: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10566965/43214746-c8247128-8fff-11e8-8ac7-17c528e70ceb.png) Initial source: ```

In dui magna, posuere eget, vestibulum et, tempor auctor, justo. Maecenas nec odio et ante tincidunt tempus. Nunc sed turpis. Fusce egestas elit eget lorem. Phasellus consectetuer INLINEvestibulum elit.

``` Add some text anywhere and press CRTL+Z and the inline plugin moves: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10566965/43214867-34390f7c-9000-11e8-8ff6-5d4acd458058.png) Source after: ```

In dui magna, posuere eget, vestibulum et, tempor auctor, justo. Maecenas nec odio et ante tincidunt tempus. Nunc sed turpis. Fusce egestas elit eget lorem. Phasellus consectetuer

INLINEvestibulum elit.

Nam pretium turpis et arcu. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Suspendisse non nisl sit amet velit hendrerit rutrum. Vestibulum purus quam, scelerisque ut, mollis sed, nonummy id, metus. Praesent vestibulum dapibus nibh.

Block

Vestibulum dapibus nunc ac augue. Sed magna purus, fermentum eu, tincidunt eu, varius ut, felis. Aenean posuere, tortor sed cursus feugiat, nunc augue blandit nunc, eu sollicitudin urna dolor sagittis lacus. Fusce fermentum odio nec arcu. Praesent blandit laoreet nibh.

items.title: ValueError due to static file resolution on import time
items.body:
[These lines](https://github.com/divio/djangocms-text-ckeditor/blob/d398fa0bbf823b8738ee909f2ede811869ca2747/djangocms_text_ckeditor/widgets.py#L22-L26) cause static file resolution on import time. Unfortunately, the module is imported on app register (through model -> fields -> widgets).

This usually works fine, but with staticfiles storage set to [`ManifestStaticFilesStorage`](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/ref/contrib/staticfiles/#django.contrib.staticfiles.storage.ManifestStaticFilesStorage) it will cause an error when the file is not in the manifest. Adding it to the manifest via `collectstatic` does not work as it causes the same error.

Resolving static files during import time seems generally not to be a good idea. Lazy evaluation via [a media property](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/forms/media/#dynamic-property) instead of an inner Media class should fix this.

items.title: Some CKEditor plugins are pinned to old version
items.body:
In version 3.5.3, **djangocms-text-ckeditor** switched from CKEditor version 4.6.2 to 4.7.3. However, many (presumably unused) plugins shipped with CKEditor have not been updated in the local source tree. This is rather confusing and may cause incompatibility errors.

Therefore, either remove those plugins, so that they have to be installed manually, or upgrade to a compatible version.

items.title: LookupError when using HTMLField in a custom user model
items.body:
I've got a custom user model in my project, but it appears to be the case that if I attempt to use a `HTMLField` within it (for example, if I want a 'biography' field), it causes a LookupError because `utils.py` imports `cms.models.CMSPlugin` which eventually tries to get the custom user model which doesn't exist yet.

Here's a simple model which should reproduce the error:

```python
from django.contrib.auth.models import AbstractBaseUser, PermissionsMixin
from djangocms_text_ckeditor.fields import HTMLField


class Individual(AbstractBaseUser, PermissionsMixin):

    biography = HTMLField(
        'professional biography',
        blank=True,
        null=True,
    )
```

and here's the relevant part of the traceback:

```bash
  File "redacted/apps/individuals/models.py", line 4, in <module>
    from djangocms_text_ckeditor.fields import HTMLField
  File ".venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/djangocms_text_ckeditor/fields.py", line 7, in <module>
    from .html import clean_html
  File ".venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/djangocms_text_ckeditor/html.py", line 14, in <module>
    from .utils import plugin_to_tag
  File ".venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/djangocms_text_ckeditor/utils.py", line 8, in <module>
    from cms.models import CMSPlugin
  File ".venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cms/models/__init__.py", line 4, in <module>
    from .permissionmodels import *  # nopyflakes
  File ".venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cms/models/permissionmodels.py", line 21, in <module>
    User = apps.get_registered_model(user_app_name, user_model_name)
  File ".venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/apps/registry.py", line 268, in get_registered_model
    "Model '%s.%s' not registered." % (app_label, model_name))
LookupError: Model 'individuals.Individual' not registered.
```

The order of apps in my `INSTALLED_APPS` is:

```
[
    'redacted.apps.individuals',
    'cms',
    'djangocms_text_ckeditor',
]
```

items.title: Can't edit text due to an attempt to load non-existent js file, but only when running in production (port 80)
items.body:
Very strange: when I am running on a server with port 8000, all is well.  When in production on port 80 (or localhost port 80), I am getting this 404 error when trying to edit a text plugin:

[26/Aug/2017 20:35:20] "GET /static/djangocms_text_ckeditor/ckeditor/plugins/copyformatting/lang/en.js?t=H0CG HTTP/1.1" 404 147

As a result, text editor does not load properly and text can't be edited.

this file does not exist at the path given above, and when running on :8000, there is no request for that URL at all.  Any ideas?....
Update: I stumbled onto this: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15786690/django-escaping-javascript-when-debug-false and tried the workaround they suggested, and it helped, which was doing this in settings:

`EXCLUDE_FROM_MINIFYING = ('^admin/', '^en/admin/')
`

items.title: Race condition between popup show and its z-index setting when plugin/placeholder is clicked multiple times
items.body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Add text plugin
2. Add link / other CMS plugin and save, then re-open the editor
3. Click rapidly on the newly created link - the popup can no longer be activated (in the demo, link "non" has been clicked multiple times in rapid succession).

No other popups can be activated until editor is closed and re-opened.

Demo of the bug in action:[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F278EmtY5ZI](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F278EmtY5ZI&feature=youtu.be)

What seems to be important is that the link/plugin being clicked is outside of the area where the popup is going to be created - i.e. if the link was to be obscured by the newly loaded popup, then multiple clicking does not make any difference. 

I could see that during that multiple clicking, the z-index of the dialog is not set correctly even when the dialog itself is created.

items.title: Failure to render subclasses of TextPlugin
items.body:
Hi,

after an update we encountered an error which does prevent us from using child plugins within subclasses of TextPlugin. I tracked the error down to here:
https://github.com/divio/djangocms-text-ckeditor/blob/3.4.0/djangocms_text_ckeditor/cms_plugins.py#L481
The issue is that the queryset is explicitly filtered on the concrete base class. Removing the filter works but might result in a performance penalty...

Regards

Jakob

items.title: Signature changes break djangocms-cascade's carousel plugin

Signature change to `plugin_tags_to_user_html(...)` breaks carousel and probably other plugins that call this method. Link to issue: https://github.com/jrief/djangocms-cascade/issues/182.

items.title: stylesSet and contentCss
items.body:
At the moment the only way to specify correct styles and config inside of ckeditor is to hardcode the paths to  them like this:

``` python
CKEDITOR_SETTINGS = {
    'stylesSet': 'default:/static/js/addons/ckeditor.wysiwyg.js',
    'contentsCss': ['/static/css/base.css'],
}
```

If you're using different place to store them, e.g. somewhere on s3 bucket or if you use hashed file names you will run into problems.

What we should do instead is to handle the given paths with `{% static %}` automatically

items.title: Document that cmswidget needs to be in extraPlugins setting
items.body:
For my installation, I had customised the `extraPlugins` setting and did not have "cmswidget" in there (and it used to worked).

With the latest version `3.1.0`, when I opened a Text plugin, [this line in plugins.js](https://github.com/divio/djangocms-text-ckeditor/blob/master/djangocms_text_ckeditor/static/djangocms_text_ckeditor/ckeditor_plugins/cmsplugins/plugin.js#L446) throws an error:

``` js
// Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property 'inline' of undefined
that.editor.widgets.registered.cmswidget.inline = true;
```

`that.editor.widgets.registered` does not contain `cmswidget`.

I had to add 'cmswidget' in the list of extraPlugins to make this work. This doesn't seem to be documented. Having a list of required "extraPlugins" for djangocms-text-ckeditor to work might be a good idea.

items.title: Not compatible with the most recent version of html5lib
items.body:
Fails with the most recent version of html5lib (`0.999999999`) with this exception:

```
  File ".../python3.4/site-packages/djangocms_text_ckeditor/html.py", line 8, in <module>
    from html5lib import sanitizer, serializer, treebuilders, treewalkers
```

This is probably caused by this change (from htlm5lib changelog): 

> Get rid of the sanitizer package. Merge sanitizer.sanitize into the sanitizer.htmlsanitizer module and move that to saniziter. This means anyone who used sanitizer.sanitize or sanitizer.HTMLSanitizer needs no code changes.

items.title: Using `replace` instead of `split` and `join`.
items.body:
When I looked at how djangocms-text-ckeditor passes settings to the template was confused about this line https://github.com/divio/djangocms-text-ckeditor/blob/3.0.1/djangocms_text_ckeditor/widgets.py#L73

```
'settings': language.join(json.dumps(configuration).split("{{ language }}")),
```

It needed to put a debugger there to inspect and see what is going on in order to understand what this line was doing. At the end I realized that the purpose of this is to replace `{{ language }}` with current language.

Isn't this the same as:

```
'settings': json.dumps(configuration).replace("{{ language }}", language)),
```

Or there is something that I'm missing?

items.title: install issue: ImportError: cannot import name 'sanitizer'
items.body:
Using the latest, when installing with the following:

```
djangocms  --parent-dir . \
--filer \
--i18n yes \
--use-tz yes \
--timezone America/New_York \
--reversion yes \

--cms-version develop \
--starting-page yes \
--no-input \
--apphooks-reload \
--no-user \
--db sqlite://localhost/project.db \
mysite
```

the install quits with the following error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/fink/Documents/work/MyLittlePony/website/MyLittlePony.com/www./source/3.0/mlp_website-virtualenv/bin/djangocms", line 11, in <module>
    sys.exit(execute())
  File "/Users/fink/Documents/work/MyLittlePony/website/MyLittlePony.com/www./source/3.0/mlp_website-virtualenv/lib/python3.4/site-packages/djangocms_installer/main.py", line 41, in execute
    django.setup_database(config_data)
  File "/Users/fink/Documents/work/MyLittlePony/website/MyLittlePony.com/www./source/3.0/mlp_website-virtualenv/lib/python3.4/site-packages/djangocms_installer/django/__init__.py", line 425, in setup_database
    output = subprocess.check_output(command, env=env)
  File "/opt/local/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.4/lib/python3.4/subprocess.py", line 617, in check_output
    raise CalledProcessError(retcode, process.args, output=output)
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['/Users/fink/Documents/work/MyLittlePony/website/MyLittlePony.com/www./source/3.0/mlp_website-virtualenv/bin/python3.4', '-W', 'ignore', 'manage.py', 'migrate']' returned non-zero exit status 1
```

According to here:
https://github.com/html5lib/html5lib-python/tree/master/html5lib/filters
sanitizer.py is located in the filters module, so perhaps line 8 from here:
https://github.com/divio/djangocms-text-ckeditor/blob/master/djangocms_text_ckeditor/html.py#L8
and line 2 from here:
https://github.com/divio/djangocms-text-ckeditor/blob/master/djangocms_text_ckeditor/sanitizer.py#L2
should instead read:

```
from html5lib.filters import sanitizer
from html5lib import treebuilders, treewalkers
```

See release notes here:
https://github.com/html5lib/html5lib-python/blob/14d4851ef707603e8c7a29278572449e4e6f9c22/CHANGES.rst#09999999910b9

items.title: 'cmsplugins' needs to work for djangocms_text_ckeditor.fields.HTMLField
items.body:
Currently djangocms-text-ckeditor's `HTMLField` doesn't have the ability to link to other CMS pages.

DjangoCMS has `cmsplugins`, a plugin for CKeditor for that. 

However as explained in `djangocms-text-ckeditor`'s README (see `Usage as a model field`), this is not supported for HTML fields. This Model Field is heavily relied upon for the creation of custom content elements in DjangoCMS. Not being able to link to CMS pages from them is quite a brutal shortcoming of DjangoCMS in comparison to other CMS systems and frameworks.

Can we have some insights into why this core piece of functionality is not implemented in djangocms-text-ckeditor?

items.title: Can't upload Image with an upload Button
items.body:
My question is: why don't you use the same widget from django-ckeditor (currently on 5.0.3 version) instead of creating a new one?

I had this error (it's not an error but I can't upload image with an upload button in the Image widget on ckeditor sidebar) either forcing my custom field using django-ckeditor's CKEditorWidget rendering the form in the admin interface. But I think it's not a good idea to modify get_editor_widget forcing to use django-ckeditor's CKEditorWidget  in cms_plugins.py because it expects other data.
The solution in that case was to use CKEditorUploadingWidget instead of CKEditorWidget.
I think that package is a good solution and can be use outside CMS too without modifying a model field declaration if you want to use in your model.

In my case i resolved this issue creating my own cms_plugin rendering the content with CKEditorUploadingWidget

Best Regards

items.body:
After maximizing the window .cke_contents container overflows unpredictably, resulting in hidden content. Re sizing browser window fixes the problem. ( Javascript probably incorrectly calculates initial height value ).

Temporary hack in cms.ckeditor.css: .cke_contents { max-height: 87vh !important; }

only in this text plugin position might be null. It is some kind of error.

items.title: Unwanted whitespace between anchor and punctuation mark
items.body: Using the TextPlugin, I'm getting this unwanted whitespace between an anchor (filer link plugin) and a trailing punctuation mark. In the developer tools, I can see that there is some kind of strange newline before the comma. If I go on and delete the whitespace there, it disappears of course. I can rule out styling, as it is persistent with all css excluded: I have observed this with both commas and full stops in djangocms 3.1 (djangocms-text-editor==2.4.3) and 3.2 (djangocms-text-editor==2.8.1) Any ideas on how to get rid of that whitespace?

items.title: Problems to open plugins window inside ckeditor when my site is running with a CDN like CloudFront
items.body:
Hi Folks!

I'm trying to use django-cms and djangocms-text-ckeditor running on my site and all JS and CSS files running on a CDN like AWS Cloudfront. So, I'm facing problems like bellow when I'm trying to call the plugin window inside the ckeditor dialog window already open, when the window freeze an none was opened and I catch this error at my JS console:

TypeError: CMS.$(...).on is not a function
https://d3ce9j2o7f76t5.cloudfront.net/djangocms_text_ckeditor/ckeditor_plugins/cmsplugins/plugin.js?t=F969
Line 82

Any one has an idea on how to deal with that?

Thanks

Rogério Carrasqueira

items.title: CSRFMiddlewaretoken
items.body:
Hi,

I'm currently running into an issue whereby djangocms_text_ckeditor doesn't send the CSRFMiddlewaretoken when adding a plugin from the dropdown menu in Django CMS.
I get a "403 Forbidden CSRF token missing or incorrect." error. When digging in the code, it seems that the CSRFMiddlewaretoken is not send.

I'm running Django 1.7.11 and Django CMS 3.1.4 with djangocms_text_ckeditor 2.8.0. When I downgrade djangocms_text_ckeditor to 2.7.0 this problem goes away.

Have you heard about this before and can this be resolved without having to downgrade?

Thanks
